basic.floral_language:
Peperomia rotundifolia 
Floriography: fresh, vigorous, exquisite
Peperomia rotundifolia is an evergreen foliage plant, also known as "Jasper". It has a miniature compact form, lavender-color (pale purple) stems, oval or nearly round leaves, young leaves fresh green like a half bean, then turning to shiny dark green, very vivid and lovely. Usually put in the study, living room, bedroom, adding greenness and vitality, is a popular plant.
Peperomia rotundifolia likes half shade environment, good for bright scattered light. Sometimes blooms with slender flowers, but with little viewing value.

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes half shade environments, put in places with bright scattered light, in winter may take 2-3h sunlight
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, may spray water in the air or rub leaves with water
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased and dead leaves timely
